Subjective: Neck spot x2 weeks. Initially thought wart, now unsure. Started as small wound post-shaving, possibly insect bite. Itches, no pain. Scabs fall off, new ones form. No similar spots elsewhere. History of wart removal (abscess ear). Family history: sun-related skin issues (father's side). ICE (Concern): Worried about skin cancer (melanoma mentioned online). ICE (Request): Wants spot removed, prefers freezing.
Objective: Neck: Raised pinkish-red spot, ~0.5 cm. Central redder area. No visible scab/crusting currently. No lymphadenopathy. Freckles noted on neck. Lungs: Not assessed. Vitals: Not assessed.
Assessment: Neck lesion, differential diagnosis includes pyogenic granuloma, atypical mole, or other benign lesion. Referral to dermatology for definitive diagnosis and management. Knee pain, likely activity-related, to be addressed in a separate visit.
Plan: 1. E-consultation to dermatology with photo. 2. Patient to call clinic Friday between 12-1:30 PM for advice (or before 10 AM / after 3 PM if unavailable). 3. Discussed treatment options: cryotherapy (preferred by patient), surgical excision, or curettage with biopsy. 4. Advised to monitor spot. 5. Knee pain: Schedule separate appointment if persistent.
